intro: Isoetes howellii var. minima, commonly known as the dwarf water moss, is a small, aquatic plant belonging to the genus Isoetes, which is part of the family Isoetaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, ribbon-like leaves that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. This variety is native to North America, particularly found in wetlands and shallow water environments. It thrives in still or slow-moving waters with muddy or sandy substrates. Due to its small size and unique morphology, it is often used in ecological studies to assess water quality and habitat health.
